job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Bradenton, FL
pros: Room for growth, generous salary and benefits
cons: Sometimes stressful environment but can be dealt with

pros: Liked the team I worked with. Benefits are pricey but they do offer discounts if you go to their providers.
cons: The pay is decent, but there is a noticeable lack of balance in terms of work and personal life.

pros: The company invites a large range of cultural diversity. Love it! They are attempting to clean up their company culture and be better as an entire organization.
cons: They do not give bonuses back to employees. They treat employees as if they are expendable. The pay ranges are low comparatively to other organizations. Leadership hierarchy consists of doctors, who know absolutely nothing about leadership.

pros: Good Benefits Lots of Overtime Former Administration was good to work for. Not sure about new.
cons: Pay is to low for living in Bradenton.

pros: For people who live 20' or less from Bradenton
cons: Toxic work environment: prevalent culture of blame throwing Management finds any reason to "write up" employees, clinical or non-clinical No company vision No professional management: no management education, no training, total lack of modern management techniques or methods. Management by phototype: phototypes 1 to 4 have no chance of advancement; types 5 and 6 have a better shot. Front desk staff are used and abused with tasks that do not belong to their job description. No respect for patients: canceled appointments are the norm, up to 3 or 4 times. Front desk staff spends 70% of their time rescheduling patients. Communication: none. Management by objectives: none. Formal 6-month or Annual Review: none, an employee can be "written up" up to three times in 3 months and be shown the door. Lack of trust: the word of upper management is worthless. An employee was told he/she could work remotely but was let go for " job abandonment". Another employee was told that her/his accrued PTO would be paid upon departure, in front of an HR witness, and actually, this PTO was never paid. Lies are a management tool. Deceit a way of life at MCR. A Practice Director takes credit for the work of others to look good to a VP who, in charge of Front desk staff, couldn't care less and doesn't do his own due diligence. The corporate CEO was abruptly "removed" in November 22 without a word of explanation. Top management is very secretive and doesn't open up to the rest of the company. Some issues concerning the safety/OSHA violations in a building have been silenced after doctors raised health concerns for employees. A newly hired physician/VP resigned after 2 weeks when he realized the mountain of issues MCR was facing. MCR is a company with no real managerial knowledge at the helm and NO understanding of how to run a healthcare organization throughout the upper echelons. There is NOT a single non-exempt employee (clinical or nonclinical) who is happy to work there.

pros: None that are worth writing here.
cons:
Mandatory overtime into the evenings during the week- overtime they tell you is "optional" in your interview. 
Sites are chronically understaffed. 
Management dictates a stressful work environment, as they want providers to always squeeze in another patient visit during the shift. 
Poor training/onboarding, as the experienced workers "don't have time for new people", and other new employees are still learning. 
HR is a disaster, as I was sent to the wrong clinical address to work at 3 times within the first month of employment. 
Poor communication regarding new policies, and management goes along with poor training in the clinical setting.
High turn-around of employees. (Asking about turn-around in my interview, I was assured that they don't have high turn-around as they still have employed a Pediatric physician for 30+ years.) While this 1 physician has been there a while, a lot of other staff come and go frequently.

pros: Lots of opportunities for various coding principles.
cons: Some benifits have decreased over the last few years

pros: Excellent paid salary’s for Medical Assistants !
cons: Need more staff to be able to assist patients at a great pace!

pros:
I have truly enjoyed my time with MCR. 
It is exciting to be a part of a team that is always innovating and looking for the most optimal and efficient way to accomplish a task. 
Our leadership is ultimately focused on the patient experience and is constantly re-evaluating every step of the patient experience. No doubt, the experience for our patients and employees will continue to improve and evolve as there has been dramatic improvements even in the past year.
It is great to be a part of an innovative, forward moving team.
cons: There is a learning curve as MCR has many departments/support wings.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Tampa, FL
pros: Good location and salary, coworkers
cons: None at this time, great place

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Bradenton, FL
pros: Lots of holidays off and bonus pays
cons: Ghetto employees, managers show favoritism

pros: I love the people I work with. Everyone has been so friendly and helpful. The opportunities to progress in my line of work are there and I'm thankful. I feel as though I have access to the information I need to perform well and they encourage employees to always make use of the vast resources we have. If I don't know where to get what I need, I can always ask someone to help. The benefits are good and that's a plus!
cons: Distance to my home is not great for mileage on my car, however, I can't help where I live.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Bradenton, FL
pros: Attentive to staff needs as in regards to unexpected family life needs. Supportive in growing within the companies tiers. Always providing the best feedback in a way of getting you to see further than the moment that it drives you to reach higher.
cons: No. None at this moment.

pros:
I've been with MCR for almost 3 years and MCR is:
* Patient Focused
* Supports the local community 
* Driven to succeed
* Excellent pay, benefits, holidays, and time off
* Growing and changing
* Great coworkers - I love the people I work with!
cons: Pace is fast for some people

pros: Great benefits, pay, thriving to provide best care for the community, good support management.
cons: None so far they have been very helpful when anything arises.

job_title: Patient Services Manager in Palmetto, FL
pros: MCR is involved in all the communities we serve, A very diverse company in both staff and Patients, MCR sees all patients insured and non insured, all doors are open for employees who have any issues to discuss.
cons: I have no downsides to provide.

pros: Good benefits, great family related holidays. Can be a great place to work if you put the work in to your site. Great providers that really care.
cons: Hard work at times but the reward is greater. Lots of online training but understand we have to stay up on compliance. Need to make it easier to get it done.

pros: Smart CEO and colleagues and terrific compensation and benefits
cons: Patient population at times is challenging

job_title: Medical Representative PSR in Bradenton, FL
pros: Great company to work for holidays off and no weekends. Company originated in Manatee county. MCR very involved in the community.
cons: Needs more staffing growing to fast.

pros: Great benefits, no weekend work, paid holidays. Great peers. Giving back to the community is very rewarding here.
cons: For some : high pace but for some others makes the day fly by.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Bradenton, FL
pros: Exalent benefits and pto vacation
cons: Turn around with employees and taking time off

review_title: Here's what you don't know about working at MCR Health!
pros: Great Benefits & Work-life balance
cons: No sick days, only PTO

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Bradenton, FL
pros: the only pros I have to say for this company is that the doctors were amazing even though as I can see from the website most of them don't work there anymore.
cons: organization of the charges and supervisors is horrible. there is no communication and there is alot of favoritism. they nit pick over things that ddon't make any since like standing the wrong way? but over look important situations like nurses being over worked. I had worked many shifts by myself with a doctor with pts scheduled every 15min for physicals on top of answering phones, my daily paper work and expected to triage walk ins. management is poor and I would never recommend a friend or family member to ever work for this company.

review_title: Rolls down from the top of the hill...
pros: Pretty new blue logo and great doctors.  Provided much needed services to the community.
cons: They think the rebranding is actually fixing the chaos and image of the organization.  Have no clue about organizational development. Middle leadership is weak and lack leadership skills. Patient Services is the worst I've seen in my 25 yr professional career, no end in sight with current leader.  Top down management like military. No one allowed to work independently and proactively.  Mid management act like a bunch of brainless puppets.  Some of them are quite talented, just afraid to stand-up to the tyrant leaders.

review_title: Good doctors, but is a mess working as a front desk personnel. Supervisors have no knowledge of what they are doing.
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist II in Bradenton, FL
pros: good doctors, and the mission and vision of the company is about patient satisfaction which is good to work for a company that cares about the community.
cons: Supervisors don't know what they are doing they flow you around. Always short staff, Bilingual personnel gets taken advantage off always has to translate for doctors, nurses and other staff even thought the company gets grants to have personnel to tanslate. Sometimes patients that don't speak English are treated poorly.

review_title: Formally Manatee County Rural Health Services - Check the Reviews
pros: Provides much needed community health to the under-served.
cons: They think the re-branding is actually fixing the chaos and image of the organization. Have no clue about organizational development. Middle leadership is weak and lack leadership skills. Patient Services is the worst I've seen in my 25 yr professional career, no end in sight with current leader. Top down management like military. No one allowed to work independently and proactively. Mid management act like a bunch of brainless puppets.  Current CEO is dishonest and unqualified.  Senior Administration are delusional and under-qualified at best. Repeated large layoffs because the senior leaders can't run a business.

pros: A lot of necessary changes have been taking place with the organization, and  the changes are making the company top-notch professional workplace. The leadership has been working hard to fix the issues but change takes time. I feel they are on the right track.  If you want to make a difference, this is the place you want to be.
cons: Long hours but definitely worth it.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Bradenton, FL
pros: Good benefits and you build up pto at a descent rate.
cons: They expect you to do to much in not enoph time where the patients care suffers for it. They constantly have you walking a thin line of what could cost you your license.

pros: Few good doctors and nurses
cons: Very sad to see many great doctors and nurses and other good employees leave. They are pushed to their limits, treated with zero respect. Harassment, lies, intimidation, threats until you bleed and leave are the theme of this company. Modern day slavery. If you open your mouth to speak the truth, prepare to be escorted out. If you just suck it up and bow your heads, you have just sentenced your life to eternal curse.

pros: MCR is dedicated to providing the best service possible to patients.  Their extensive services and sites cater to meet the needs of the community.  Employees are valued and encouraged to succeed.
cons: Communication is the weakest link; with so many sites some information gets lost before all employees are made aware of any changes.

job_title: Medical Billing and Coding Specialist in Bradenton, FL
pros: Very thorough training, co-workers awesome. Decent pay for the work.
cons: Management in my office, not medicaally trained.

pros: good benefits, many locations to try to fit to your schedule
cons: lack of communication from upper management
